etymology.description: Pictogram: a luxuriant plant growing on the ground (土); the bottom stroke is missing in the modern form.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a lush plant sprouting from the soil, naturally extending to the idea of abundance and fullness. Over time the base stroke for “ground” was lost, leaving a streamlined shape that still suggests upright, thriving growth.
etymology.simplification: Mainland reform replaced 豐 with the older pictographic form 丰, dropping the 豆 ‘vessel’ component and reverting to a simpler ancient glyph to reduce strokes.

examples.chinese: 今年风调雨顺(今年風調雨順)，粮食丰收(糧食豐收)。
examples.english: This year the weather was favorable, and the grain harvest was abundant.

examples.chinese: 这个地区物产丰富(這個地區物產豐富)。
examples.english: This region is rich in products and resources.

examples.chinese: 五谷丰登(五穀豐登)，家家喜庆(家家喜慶)。
examples.english: With all grains abundant, every household celebrates.
